channel.title: 20gb flatrate with cap
channel.description:
hi ive got a small problem. my internet plan is a 20gb flatrate with cap. Im 2 days away from the new month and im 20gb's over my cap because they havent capped me yet. I havent changed plans either, and when i logon to my account and have a look at my plan it still says 20480mb limit, the next plan up is a 40gb plan so i definitely havent been swapped to another plan.
Should i keep abusing my internet untill it caps if (if at all?)

item.title: 20gb flatrate with cap
item.dc:creator: Cameron_D
item.description:
That is because just about all the ISPs route through 1 ISP (the most expensive one - yay for monopolies).

At least we’re finally getting FTTH (albeit its ridiculously priced)

Read full topic

item.title: 20gb flatrate with cap
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
dude in Australia even the fastest and most expensive ISP will give you 400ms+ ping to any IP outside of Aus.

Read full topic

item.title: 20gb flatrate with cap
item.dc:creator: Cameron_D
item.description:
Maverix26:

Do you live in mexico, or are of mexican descent? (I am not trying to be prejudiced, just asking)

Either way, get with the times man, everyone has unlimited internet now

Try tell the Australian government that…

“Oh, no, by 2017 we want everyone on 12mbps copper”

Read full topic

item.title: 20gb flatrate with cap
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
Samapico:

Distributel… we have their DSL internet + VoIP phone service, it’s 5mbps, but totally unlimited. Radioactif also offers unlimited DSL.
But if you want unlimited with Bell or Videotron, forget it… I think even their biggest plan are not unlimited (couple of hundred Go’s) and cost “une osti d’beurrée”…

Acanac is the unlimited provider I use in town.
Still only 5Mb, but meh. Downloading doesn’t really feel hampered that much.

Read full topic

item.title: 20gb flatrate with cap
item.dc:creator: russilker
item.description:
I can’t imagine having metered internet again. Going from dialup to 768kbps DSL to 3mbps cable to 20mbps cable to (right now) 25mbps upload/download speed FiOS has left me spoiled…

Read full topic

item.title: 20gb flatrate with cap
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
yeah ca coute cher en tabarnak

but my mom doesn’t wanna switch to videotron or any other company so I settle for cracking wep and stealing from my neighbors (they have teksavvy unlimited)

Read full topic

item.title: 20gb flatrate with cap
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
sersoft:

Unlimited has been pretty much wiped out from existence over here, my mom lost her credit card and cancelled the old phone bill with unlimited 10mbps now we’re stuck with 60gb for both upload and download for twice the price and it never goes above 6mbps while my friend with the unlimited cable contract just upgraded to 33mbps today

Distributel… we have their DSL internet + VoIP phone service, it’s 5mbps, but totally unlimited. Radioactif also offers unlimited DSL.
But if you want unlimited with Bell or Videotron, forget it… I think even their biggest plan are not unlimited (couple of hundred Go’s) and cost “une osti d’beurrée”…

item.title: 20gb flatrate with cap
item.dc:creator: johnyo
item.description:
~$40 for an 8MBit DSL here. Internet traffic and landline unlimited.

If I lived in a flat a few streets away I’d have 20Mbit for $20. :hmph:

item.title: 20gb flatrate with cap
item.dc:creator: MaxTheLimit
item.description:
In town I have unlimited for 30 bucks on a 5MB DSL line.
Back in the Perth location I had paid 80 bucks for 80GB ( max 40GB download / Max 40GB upload ). It was more expensive because it was wireless. It was a 6M connection though.

oh u. I live in Australia; we have metered uploads, shitting internet speeds and capped plans. I was living on 12GB a month up until recently; we went over more times than I care to remember.

item.title: 20gb flatrate with cap
item.dc:creator: sersoft
item.description:
stop using the internet unless your ISP has a limit on the overcharge price

mine is 60$ for 60GB with a limit of 30$ for going over but I feel it’s gonna change soon because I download ~300 gigs on top of my 60gb cap every month (my parents use a russian HDTV streaming service)

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: 20gb flatrate with cap
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
I remember when ‘unlimited’ internet meant you could stay connected on dial-up for an unlimited time, and the limits were in hours…

Read full topic

item.title: 20gb flatrate with cap
item.dc:creator: p0rt1r
item.description:
i tell ya, ive been on an unlimited plan for atleast 6 years. Now they closed my plan and im stuck with a 20gb plan. It used to be like 50-60$ per month for unlimited, now its the same price for 20gb. the first month i blew my cap reaaally fast.
I must say tho, after having the past few days of unlimited, ive ran out of stuff to download

Read full topic

item.title: 20gb flatrate with cap
item.dc:creator: Samapico
item.description:
Usually they won’t cap you… if they explicitely said that they would block your internetz when you go over the limit and cannot be charged unless you tell them so, you should be fine. Otherwise, expect a nice bill…

Last year when I lived in university residences, they were providing us the Internet access. We had a 100gb limit per month (for a 4-rooms appartment), and since we weren’t paying directly for the internet, they capped us if we went over. But we noticed they only updated the bandwidth usage at the end of each day, and blocked only then if needed for the rest of the month. So the last day of the month, we technically had unlimited download lol. After a few months of downloading 90-95Gb the first 30 days, and another 100Gb on the last day, they changed their system to update the bandwidth more frequently

Read full topic

item.title: 20gb flatrate with cap
item.dc:creator: Victus
item.description:
JeffMOD:

At least you HAVE 20gb. I’m stuck on a crappy ‘mobile internet stick’ .5GB plan.
I decided to stick with dialup for everything but important downloads.

Like Black Mesa of course.

I’m curious though, have you noticed any strange activity around your house OP? Those internet police bandwidth guys are sneaky little things. :ninja:

Read full topic
